definition: to quit while one is ahead (idiom)/to know when to stop
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello

at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)

sentences.english: Example: Enjoy it! You can't have too much of a good thing.
sentences.chinese: 见好就收吧你不可能太走运了。

sentences.english: I won't interference you from now on !
I decided the best thing to do was to graciously bow out.
sentences.chinese: 于是我做了一个最佳的决定，那就是优雅地见好就收。

sentences.english: He courted a lot, but never boiled over, just simmered.
sentences.chinese: 他曾追求过很多女孩，但从不过热，见好就收。

sentences.english: Almost on the line now, just leave.
sentences.chinese: 差不多就行吧，见好就收。

sentences.english: You can't have too much of a good thing.
sentences.chinese: 见好就收吧，你不可能太走运了。

definition: to stop before going too far (idiom); to stop while one can/don't overdo it/stop while you're ahead
to stop/to pull back
to zealously continue fighting
you don't release the hawk until you've seen the hare (idiom)/one doesn't act before one is sure to succeed
pinyin: bu4 jian4 tu4 zi5 bu4 sa1 ying1

definition: to advance prematurely
lit. to pull chestnuts out of the fire (idiom)/fig. to be sb's cat's-paw
(idiom) great plans can be ruined by just a touch of impatience
pinyin: xiao3 bu4 ren3 ze2 luan4 da4 mou2

definition: Only an outstanding talent can recognize current trends (idiom). A wise man submits to circumstances.
pinyin: shi2 shi2 wu4 zhe3 wei4 jun4 jie2

definition: use a long line to catch a big fish (idiom); a long-term plan for major returns
pinyin: fang4 chang2 xian4 diao4 da4 yu2

definition: see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
greedy
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
to speculate (on financial markets)/opportunistic/congenial/agreeable
to keep cool/to stay calm
so pleased as to lose one's sense of measure/beside oneself with joy
lit. to push the boat with the current/fig. to take advantage of the situation for one's own benefit
